thread.title: Rutgers uses incredible rally to shock Indiana 55-52
thread.title_full: Rutgers uses incredible rally to shock Indiana 55-52

title: Rutgers uses incredible rally to shock Indiana 55-52
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Rutgers uses incredible rally to shock Indiana 55-52 Rutgers converted three fourth-quarter turnovers into touchdowns and kicker Kyle Federico capped an improbable comeback by making a 26-yard field goal as time expired Saturday for a 55-52 victory at Indiana. WHAS11.com: http://on.whas11.com/1LBcQxx   Join the Conversation To   Rutgers uses incredible rally to shock Indiana 55-52 Associated Press 7:55 p.m. EDT October 17, 2015 Oct 17, 2015; Bloomington, IN, USA; Rutgers Scarlet Knights wide receiver Janarion Grant (1) is hit by Indiana Hoosiers defensive back Rashard Fant (16) in the first half of their game at Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matt Kryger-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Matt Kryger, Matt Kryger-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BLOOMINGTON, Ind. (AP) - Rutgers converted three fourth-quarter turnovers into touchdowns and kicker Kyle Federico capped an improbable comeback by making a 26-yard field goal as time expired Saturday for a 55-52 victory at Indiana. 
The Scarlet Knights (3-3, 1-2 Big Ten) tied a school record by rallying from a 25-point deficit in the final 20Â½ minutes. 
Federico won it after having two extra points blocked. 
Chris Laviano led Rutgers by going 28 of 42 for 386 yards with three touchdowns and one interception. 
But it was a botched snap on a rare Indiana punt that turned the game. Kemoko Turay scooped it up and scored on a 26-yard return to make it 52-39. 
Rutgers then took advantage of both of Nate Sudfeld's interceptions to tie the score at 52. 
Sudfeld was 32 of 42 for a career high 464 yards with four TDs for Indiana (4-3, 0-3), which lost its third straight. Read or Share this story: http://on.whas11.com/1LBcQxx TOP VIDEOS
